Package com.redis.foundation.std

Class StrUtl

java.lang.Object
com.redis.foundation.std.StrUtl
public class StrUtl extends Object
The StrUtl class provides utility methods for manipulating and evaluating String objects. The goal of this class is to centralize commonly used string manipulation methods and to encourage code re-use.

The Apache Commons has a number of good utility methods for string values. http://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-lang/index.html

Since:
1.0
Author:
Al Cole

  • Method Details

    • firstCharToUpper

      public static String firstCharToUpper(String aName)
      Given a lowercase name, this method will make it a proper name by capitalizing the first character.
      Parameters:
      aName - Lowercase name.
      Returns:
      Proper name.

    • booleanToString

      public static String booleanToString(boolean aFlag)
      Given a boolean value, return a string object representation of its value.
      Parameters:
      aFlag - A boolean flag value.
      Returns:
      StrUtl.STRING_TRUE or StrUtl.STRING_FALSE

    • stringToBoolean

      public static boolean stringToBoolean(String aString)
      Given a String object representing a boolean value of StrUtl.STRING_TRUE or StrUtl.STRING_FALSE it will return true or false.
      Parameters:
      aString - A non-empty string value.
      Returns:
      true or false depending on String value.

    • removeAllChar

      public static String removeAllChar(String aString, char aChar)
      Remove all references to a character from a string.
      Parameters:
      aString - A source string.
      aChar - Identifies the character to remove.
      Returns:
      A newly constructed String object with all the characters removed.

    • removeDuplicateChar

      public static String removeDuplicateChar(String aString, char aChar)
      Removes a duplicate character (meaning it repeats two more more times) from the string.
      Parameters:
      aString - A source string.
      aChar - A repeating character.
      Returns:
      Update string.

    • trimLastChar

      public static String trimLastChar(String aString)
      Trims the last character from the string.
      Parameters:
      aString - A source string.
      Returns:
      Trimmed string.

    • replaceCharWithString

      public static String replaceCharWithString(String aSource, char aChar, String aReplacement)
      Replaces all references to a character with a string.
      Parameters:
      aSource - A source string.
      aChar - Identifies the character to replace.
      aReplacement - A replacement string for the matching character.
      Returns:
      A newly constructed String object with all the characters replaced.

    • escapeChar

      public static String escapeChar(String aSource, char aTargetChar, char anEscapeChar)
      Escapes the target character with the escape character.
      Parameters:
      aSource - Source string
      aTargetChar - Target character
      anEscapeChar - Escape character
      Returns:
      Escaped string

    • centerSpaces

      public static String centerSpaces(String aString, int aWidth)
      Given a string and a desired width (think console presentation), this method will pad the string with the appropriate number of space characters.
      Parameters:
      aString - A non-empty string.
      aWidth - The width of the presentation console (e.g. 80 characters).
      Returns:
      A newly constructed String object with the original text centered for the aWidth value.

    • lastWordIndex

      public static int lastWordIndex(String aString, int aPosition)
      Given a string and a starting offset position (within the string), this method will identify the position (character offset) where the last word in the string can be found.
      Parameters:
      aString - A non-empty string of words.
      aPosition - Starting offset to evaluate from.
      Returns:
      The offset where the last word can be found or the value of -1 to signify that there were no space seperated words left in the string.

    • wrapToStream

      public static void wrapToStream(String aString, int aLeftMargin, int aLineWidth, PrintStream aStream)
      Given a string with a paragraph of words, a left margin pad size, the width of the console or report page and an output stream, this method will break the string into a formatted paragraph.
      Parameters:
      aString - A collection of words.
      aLeftMargin - Each line will be padded with this many spaces.
      aLineWidth - Identifies where characters should be wrapped.
      aStream - An output stream where each line will be written to.

    • simple13Rotation

      public static String simple13Rotation(String aString)
      Uses a simple Caesar-cypher encryption to replace each English letter with the one 13 places forward or back along the alphabet, so that "The butler did it!" becomes "Gur ohgyre qvq vg!". major advantage of rot13 over rot(N) for other N is that it is self-inverse, so the same code can be used for encoding and decoding.
      Parameters:
      aString - A plain text string to encode.
      Returns:
      An encrypted String object.

    • hidePassword

      public static String hidePassword(String aStringPlain)
      Uses a simple Caesar-cypher encryption to replace each English letter with the one 13 places forward or back along the alphabet, so that "The butler did it!" becomes "Gur ohgyre qvq vg!". major advantage of rot13 over rot(N) for other N is that it is self-inverse, so the same code can be used for encoding and decoding.

      Note: The returned string will be wrapped with the less-than and greater-than characters to signify that they were encrypted by this method. These wrappers will be expected when the string is recovered.

      Parameters:
      aStringPlain - A plain text string to encode.
      Returns:
      An encrypted String object.

    • isHidden

      public static boolean isHidden(String aString)
      Determines if the string has been encrypted to hide is contents.
      Parameters:
      aString - A simple string value.
      Returns:
      true if hidden (encrypted) and false otherwise.

    • recoverPassword

      public static String recoverPassword(String aStringPassword)
      Recovers a previously encrypted hidePassword string and returns it in its original form.

      Note: The input string must be wrapped with the less-than and greater-than characters to signify that they were previously encrypted by the hidePassword method.

      Parameters:
      aStringPassword - An encrypted password string.
      Returns:
      A decrypted String object.

    • endsWithChar

      public static boolean endsWithChar(String aString, char aChar)
      Determines if the last character in the string matches.
      Parameters:
      aString - A source string.
      aChar - Identifies the character to match.
      Returns:
      true if character exists or false

    • appendCharIfMissing

      public static String appendCharIfMissing(String aString, char aChar)
      Appends the character to the string if it is missing.
      Parameters:
      aString - A source string.
      aChar - Identifies the character to append (if missing).
      Returns:
      The updated string if the character was missing.

    • escapeStringWithBackslash

      public static String escapeStringWithBackslash(String aString, char aCharToEscape)
      Escape aCharToEscape in the string with a Java escape character (backslash).
      Parameters:
      aString - String to process.
      aCharToEscape - The character to be escaped.
      Returns:
      An escaped string

    • unEscapeStringWithBackslash

      public static String unEscapeStringWithBackslash(String aString, char aCharToEscape)
      Unescape aCharToEscape in the string recognizing a Java escape character (backslash).
      Parameters:
      aString - String to process.
      aCharToEscape - The character to be escaped.
      Returns:
      An escaped string

    • isMultiValue

      public static boolean isMultiValue(String aString, char aDelimiterChar)
      Detects if the delimiter character (used to delineate multiple values) exists in the string.
      Parameters:
      aString - String to examine
      aDelimiterChar - Delimiter character.
      Returns:
      true if match count greater-than zero and false otherwise

    • collapseToSingle

      public static String collapseToSingle(ArrayList<String> aStrings, char aDelimiterChar)
      Collapses the list of strings down to one string. Each value is separated by a delimiter character.
      Parameters:
      aStrings - List of strings to process.
      aDelimiterChar - Delimiter character.
      Returns:
      A collapsed string.

    • expandToList

      public static ArrayList<String> expandToList(String aString, char aDelimiterChar)
      Expand the string into a list of individual values using the delimiter character to identify each one.
      Parameters:
      aString - One or more values separated by a delimiter character.
      aDelimiterChar - Delimiter character.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of String instances.

    • convertToMulti

      public static String[] convertToMulti(ArrayList<?> anArrayList)
      Convenience method that converts a generic ArrayList of Objects into an array of string values.
      Parameters:
      anArrayList - Array of value object instances.
      Returns:
      An array of values extracted from the array list.

    • isWildcardMatch

      public static boolean isWildcardMatch(String aString, String aPattern)
      Determines if the patten (with one or more wildcards) matches the string.
      Parameters:
      aString - String to evaluate.
      aPattern - Wildcard pattern.
      Returns:
      true or false

    • bytesToString

      public static String bytesToString(long aSizeInBytes)
      Formats the size (in bytes) in a human readable string of bytes, KB, MB, GB and TB.
      Parameters:
      aSizeInBytes - Size in bytes.
      Returns:
      Formatted string.
